20 Years of¬†Gentoo

Gentoo, a source-based Linux distribution, has steadily declined in popularity since its launch 20 years ago. However, it remains a good distribution for learning about Linux and for those wanting fully customizable installs with only desired features included. Gentoo's USE flags feature allows users to specify what features they want in packages. Gentoo does have some issues, however, such as a slow package manager, dated repository, and dependency hell. The distribution is notorious for occasional system breakages. Gentoo's founder left the project in 2004, and the Gentoo Foundation's charter was revoked in 2007 due to neglect. Despite these issues, Gentoo will likely continue to attract developers for years to come.

- Gentoo, a source-based Linux distribution, has steadily declined in popularity since its launch 20 years ago.
- Gentoo is good for learning about Linux and for those wanting fully customizable installs with only the desired features included.
- Gentoo offers USE flags to specify package features.
- Gentoo has some issues including a slow package manager, dated repository, and dependency hell.
- Gentoo is notorious for occasional system breakages.
- Gentoo's founder left the project in 2004, and the Gentoo Foundation's charter was revoked in 2007 due to neglect.
- Despite these issues, Gentoo will likely continue to attract developers for years to come.
‚ö†Ô∏è Addressing GitHub‚Äôs recent availability issues | The GitHub Blog - https://github.blog/2023-05-16-addressing-githubs-recent-availability-issues/

Addressing GitHub‚Äôs recent availability issues | The GitHub Blog

GitHub has addressed recent availability issues and communicated the steps they are taking to prevent similar incidents in the future. There were three incidents that impacted the availability of the platform due to Git database and GitHub App authentication token issuance issues. These incidents negatively impacted several services, including GitHub Actions, workflows, pull requests, and GitHub Codespaces. GitHub is taking steps to improve internal processes, mitigate future failures, and increase observability of high-cost, low-volume query patterns.

- Three incidents impacted GitHub's availability recently due to Git database and GitHub App authentication token issuance issues
- These incidents had negative impacts on several services, including GitHub Actions, workflows, pull requests, and GitHub Codespaces
- GitHub is reviewing internal processes and making adjustments to ensure safe deployment of changes in the future
- The team is analyzing the impact of these incidents to reduce their impact in the future
- GitHub is improving observability of high-cost, low-volume query patterns
- They are addressing the Git database issue that caused more than one incident and ensuring failovers recover fully without intervention
- GitHub is committed to transparency and will include these incidents in their monthly availability report.

Founders‚Äô email to Clubhouse employees

Clubhouse's founders announced that the company is reducing its staff size by over 50%, as they need to reset the company and focus on a smaller, product-focused team. To the departing employees, they will be providing severance pay, equity acceleration, healthcare, laptops, and career support. For those staying, Clubhouse will have a brief team meeting to talk about the future together.

- Clubhouse will reduce its staff size by over 50% to focus on a smaller, product-focused team.
- Clubhouse has difficulties communicating strategies to cross-functional teams and making quick changes with each surface owned by different product squads, which leads to difficulties in coordination and underutilized employees.
- Departing employees will receive severance pay, equity acceleration, healthcare, laptops, and career support.
- The company will help departing employees find their next role and provide immigration support for those who have visas.
- The founders believe that the world needs what Clubhouse is building, and that the company has a clear vision for Clubhouse 2.0.
- Those who are not impacted will have a brief team meeting to talk about the future together.
- The founders are grateful for the role that each departing employee played in building Clubhouse and they would rehire any of them in a second if they could.
‚ö†Ô∏è Testing a new encrypted messaging app's extraordinary claims - https://crnkovic.dev/testing-converso/

Testing a new encrypted messaging app's extraordinary claims

A blogger reverse-engineered Converso, a self-proclaimed "state-of-the-art" encrypted messaging app, and found that its end-to-end encryption is based on RSA, which is one of the oldest encryption standards, and that it doesn't live up to its claims to leave "absolutely no metadata". The blogger concludes by pointing out that potential privacy concerns, like the lack of guarding against man-in-the-middle attacks and the absence of forward or future secrecy, make Converso a poor choice for people who are serious about their privacy.

- Converso app's claims to provide state-of-the-art privacy, no storage of messages on the server, and no metadata do not hold up.
- The app uses RSA, one of the oldest encryption standards available.
- Seald, a third-party authority, serves as the sole certificate authority for mapping identities to public keys, which opens up the possibility for impersonation.
- Converso has servers, so the claim it doesn't use them is false.
- The app collects user data, stores it, and sends it to third-parties, which violates the claim of no use of user data.
- Converso's encryption protocol lacks protection from man-in-the-middle attacks and message authentication.
- The blogger concludes that Converso's encryption protocol is rudimentary and susceptible to a multitude of attacks.

Targeted dream incubation at sleep onset increases post-sleep creative performance | Scientific Reports

A study by MIT researchers has found that targeted dream incubation, prompted by audio cues during sleep onset, can increase creative performance in waking hours. Participants were randomly assigned to four groups, with a combination of sleep or wake states, and incubation or no-incubation conditions, and then completed three validated creativity assessments. The Sleep Incubation group, who received prompts relating to "tree" during sleep onset, showed the greatest gains in creativity performance.

- Researchers at MIT have found that targeted dream incubation can boost creativity performance in awake hours.
- Participants were randomly assigned to four groups, with a combination of sleep or wake states, and incubation or no-incubation conditions.
- The Sleep Incubation group, who were prompted with "tree" audio cues during sleep onset, showed the greatest gains in creativity performance.
- Participants completed three validated creativity assessments after the incubation period.
- The Dormio sleep tracker and app was used to record verbal reports from participants and facilitate the dream incubation protocol.
- Targeted dream incubation (TDI) is a protocol for introducing specific content into sleep-onset dreams.
- Creativity assessments were the Creative Storytelling Task, Alternative Uses Task, and Verb Generation Task.

Announcing General Availability of Earthly Satellites - Earthly Blog

Earthly Satellites, remote build runners managed by the Earthly team, have moved from beta to General Availability (GA). Users can speed up CI builds in sandboxed CI environments, share compute and cache with coworkers or CI, execute builds on x86 architecture natively, and take advantage of high-bandwidth internet access from the satellite. The executes builds with high parallelism and caching and streams build logs, artifacts, or deployments back to the user's computer or CI in real-time. Ses Goe, a Satellites user, praised the inline cache and the cache being attached to the Docker image. On average, Satellites reduced build times from 20 minutes to 4 or 5.

[5/8] +2 –æ—Ç Igor Labutin
John A De Goes (the founder of the ZIO ecosystem): ¬´I am officially stepping down as Scala evangelist and champion.¬ª

https://degoes.net/articles/splendid-scala-journey

A Splendid Scala Journey ‚Äì John A De Goes

John A De Goes, one of the oldest Scala programmers, has announced that he is stepping down as Scala evangelist and champion, due to the language's decline in adoption within the industry since 2017, and challenges that come with upgrading to Scala 3. He plans to diversify his contributions and expand into new programming languages.

- Scala's adoption has been declining since 2017, mainly due to the challenges of upgrading to Scala 3, which is essentially a new language, and has had numerous bugs and features that the industry isn't demanding.
- Companies are looking for alternative languages that better meet their needs, and the majority of commercial users are still on Scala 2 and lack significant incentives to upgrade.
- John A De Goes has tried to influence change by becoming a commercial sponsor of the official Scala Center and joining the advisory board, but has come to the conclusion that he has done all he can do.
- He plans to step down as Scala evangelist and champion, and will no longer lobby for any Scala improvements, but will still contribute to the ZIO ecosystem through mentorship and commercial support contracts.
- He is diversifying his educational content, open source contributions, and mentorship, expanding into new programming languages, and currently enjoying writing some Rust.
- He still has a deep affection for Scala, and wishes the language the very best for the future.

–ö–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏—è Sightful, –∏–∑ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π –∏ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π –ø—Ä–∏–Ω–∞–¥–ª–µ–∂–∞–ª–∏ –∫ Magic Leap, –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏–ª–∞ –Ω–æ–≤—É—é –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ–ø—Ü–∏—é –≥–∏–±—Ä–∏–¥–Ω–æ–≥–æ —É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∞ ‚Äî –ª–∞–ø—Ç–æ–ø–∞ –∏ AR-–æ—á–∫–æ–≤ Spacetop, —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é—â–∏—Ö –Ω–∞ Android –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–æ —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –¥–µ—Å–∫—Ç–æ–ø–Ω–æ–≥–æ –û–°. –≠—Ç–æ —É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π—Å—Ç–≤–æ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å –ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–º –∫–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–º –≥—Ä—è–¥—É—â–µ–π AR/VR –≥–∞—Ä–Ω–∏—Ç—É—Ä–µ Apple.

* Spacetop ‚Äì —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–µ–±–æ–ª—å—à–æ–π –Ω–æ—É—Ç–±—É–∫ —Å AR-–æ—á–∫–∞–º–∏ –≤ —Å–∫–ª–∞–¥–Ω–æ–º —á–µ—Ö–ª–µ, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –º–æ–≥—É—Ç —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–≤–∞—Ç—å –≤–∏—Ä—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π 100-–¥—é–π–º–æ–≤—ã–π —ç–∫—Ä–∞–Ω.

Compromised from Within: The Unauthorized Restoration of TorGuard‚Äôs Telegram Channel

TorGuard had to intervene in Iran after a scam by VPNclub, which was masquerading as an official reseller, stealing money from Iranian users.

TorGuard established an official channel on Telegram to provide a trustworthy way for Iranians to sign up for its services and have access to the open internet.

TorGuard faced numerous unauthorized VPN sellers on Telegram, particularly VPNclub, which engaged in fraudulent practices and posed severe threats to user privacy.

TorGuard encountered a lack of accountability and silence from Telegram in addressing these issues, and suspicions arose about a pay-to-play program among Telegram insiders.

TorGuard discontinued its original Telegram channel, which was then restored by Moslem Motaghi, leading to a daring operation to penetrate a secret Telegram channel and ultimately overcome the challenges.
